name: Food-Dehydrator Machine 12 Stainless Steel Trays, 800W Dehydrator for Herbs, 10.9ft² Meat Dehydrator for Jerky,190ºF Temperature Control,24H Timer,Powerful Drying Capacity for Fruits,Yogurt
about_this_item: 【HIGH EFFICIENCY TECHNOLOGY UPGRADE】Cercker 12 trays food dehydrator madchine adopts a rear 2 row drying fan & air circulation technology upgrade.Wind speed of 2 m/s,1600 rpm. Provide a heat evenly distributed and efficient food drying process

【STAINLESS STEEL DESIGN】This food dehydrator is made of 100% BPA-free food-grade stainless steel. It’s corrosion-resistant & fire resistance is good.It is normal for stainless steel to have an odor. Please open the door and ventilate for 1-3 days

【DEHYDRATOR 12 TRAYS】Commercial food dehydrator have 12 layer food grade stainless steel trays 11.5 in, with a wrapped design,used for dishwasher. Large capacity, allowing for drying of vegetables, fruits, meat etc, while retaining nutrition in the food

【ELECTRONIC THERMOSTAT & TIMER】This dehydrator can adjust the temperature from 70℉to 190℉ (increments 5℉) and timer have 24h ( increments 0.5h) It can ensure the efficiency of drying various foods.Light control on the back button of the machine

【SAFE,INTELLIGENT,LOW NOISE】Intelligent shutdown function of the 800W, 120 V food dehydrator starts immediately after the timer ends. Once the dehydrator machine reaches 120 °C (including surroundings), overheating protection will be start & noise ≤50 dB

【CERCKER SERVICE】Cercker 12 trays food dehydrator set have recipe, door handle, drip tray, silicone gloves, screwdriver and food dehydrator user manual.If you have any questions about product.We will provide you with unconditional support and assistance

title: The size of your dehydrator
content: I got this one, but I don’t like it didn’t come with silicone trays works good. I tried it out. Dehydrating garlic made my own garlic granulated very quiet easy to use problem. Is it too narrow should’ve got a wider one and not as tall. I think I liked around ones.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: It works, but the controls just do not make any sense. There are two on/off buttons, and none of them turns off the whole thing. When the timer ends the cycle, the vents stops, but the lights are always on. Or if you turn the switch on the back, the lights turn off, but the vents still working. I had to put an extra power strip to have the plug. And it is not energy-efficient at all, no thermal isolation or heat recovery. It is basically, a tin can with shelves, heating element, and a fan.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2024

title: The controls are bizzare, but it works.
content: Works great, but it is made of parts with very sharp edges, so be careful!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: Received the replacement - it did the same thing. Unable to power off the machine with the power button on the machine. HOWEVER - if you plug it into a GFCI Outlet - you can push the outlet button to kill power to that circuit, thus resulting in turning off the machine safely.  It is a good work-around for the machine not powering off at the power button. Unsafe to pull a plug while anything is still on - but most know that already.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024

title: Upgraded To This Dehydrator
content: I have had a plastic round tray dehydrator for a number of years that I like but I wanted to do more at once and have a quieter machine, could clean easier, and could control the temperature. This met all those requirements. I make a lot of carnivore jerky and this does a great job. I also like to make carnivore chips and the drawback with this is the ultra thin meat dries into the grate. I needed to cut parchment paper for each tray which is not cost effective and a bit time consuming. I recommend this dehydrator come with mats to precent this. Additionally, adding parchment paper helps to maintain more of the fat and thus a more buttery flavor to your jerky and meat chips.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2024

title: Great dehydrator, but WATCH THE EDGES! OW!
content: I've used the dehydrator for chicken, beef and bananas so far, and all came out perfectly! Very easy to use, simply time and temperature setting. The fan cane be a bit loud sometimes, but we set it up in the basement and we don't hear it upstairs, and the sound isn't loud enough that we are bothered by it when we're in the same room with it. The only major drawback is that EVERY bit of metal that has an exposed, cut edge is *insanely* sharp. After moving it into its home and opening the door, I'm sporting several new bandages and pretty gnarly cuts. It's worth the potential maiming though, it's a great dehydrator and the dogs are bonkers for the dried treats its cranking out.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2024
